name: Helion Energy
headline: Building the world's first fusion power plant
description: Helion is creating the world’s first fusion power plant, enabling a future with unlimited zero-carbon electricity.
generated_description:
Helion Energy is on a bold mission: to build the world's first fusion power plant, with the ultimate goal of providing unlimited zero-carbon electricity. Founded in 2013 and based in Everett, WA, Helion is driven by the promise of fusion energy—a clean and sustainable source of power that could reshape the energy landscape.

As part of Y Combinator’s Batch S14, Helion is not just a startup; it’s a dream fueled by 150 dedicated employees who share a vision for a greener future. The team is guided by Dalton Caldwell, a Group Partner at Y Combinator, lending valuable mentorship and insight as Helion navigates this complex field.

Helion's technology is centered around a practical fusion approach designed explicitly for electricity production. Their key projects, "Trenta" and "Polaris," represent the forefront of their innovative breakthroughs in harnessing fusion power efficiently.

As they continue to develop their technology, Helion is engaging with a wider audience of potential collaborators and hires, emphasizing that tackling the monumental challenge of sustainable energy requires a collection of great minds.

For insights and updates on their journey, you can check out their website at [helionenergy.com](http://helionenergy.com). They'll also keep you informed if you sign up for their newsletter. If you're passionate about the future of energy and think you can contribute, Helion is hiring. It’s an exciting opportunity to join a team that’s working to solve one of the world’s biggest challenges. 

So, if you're curious about the next frontier of energy—a future where fusion is within reach—Helion Energy is one to watch.
